rows.label: tlk41700151_04_msg0001
rows.name:
Well, I did my research, and I feel
like I'm properly informed about
Brionac now.

rows.label: tlk41700151_04_msg0002
rows.name:
Apparently they're an organization who
want to overthrow the current Emperor.

rows.label: tlk41700151_04_msg0003
rows.name:
The current Emperor strives for peace,
but some people want Superbia to
proactively conquer more territory.

rows.label: tlk41700151_04_msg0004
rows.name:
The word on the street is that Brionac
is probably supported by a radical
faction within the Senate.

rows.label: tlk41700151_04_msg0005
rows.name:
Brionac is made up of highly patriotic
Superbians - people who believe in the
glory of the Empire.

rows.label: tlk41700151_04_msg0006
rows.name:
But apparently there's also a different
organization called Lindwurm.

rows.label: tlk41700151_04_msg0007
rows.name:
Unlike Brionac, Lindwurm is primarily
made up of non-Superbians.

rows.label: tlk41700151_04_msg0008
rows.name:
Rather than opposing the current
Emperor specifically, they're more
opposed to the Superbian Empire itself.

rows.label: tlk41700151_04_msg0009
rows.name:
Their activities are supposedly
masterminded by Invidian nobility
and Nopon merchants.

rows.label: tlk41700151_04_msg0010
rows.name:
Since Lindwurm's objective is to crush
the Empire itself, they see both the
Imperial Army and Brionac as enemies.

rows.label: tlk41700151_04_msg0011
rows.name:
Recently, though, Lindwurm's leader
made some rash moves in an attempt to
avenge his son, and was taken down.

rows.label: tlk41700151_04_msg0012
rows.name:
So both organizations are in tatters at
this point. The handful of radicals that
remain are no threat to the Emperor.
